title: Statistical Feature Extraction and Dimensionality Reduction Techniques for MRI Brain Tumor Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical statistics, machine learning concepts, and Python programming experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening preservice teachers' foundational competency to understand medical imaging analysis technology through mathematical approaches and apply it in educational settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods for extracting statistical features (texture, intensity distribution, etc.) from MRI brain images.
Learners can practice feature dimension reduction using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA).
Learners can implement a brain tumor classification model applying Bayes classifiers and kNN algorithms and evaluate its accuracy.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
